One prediction that I am much more confident about:

2 quarters from now interest from both bulls and bears in deliveries and production numbers will be far less.

Attention will turn to restructuring the $TSLA business.

I am witnessing the effect of competition day by day.

So far $TSLA is trying to get the inventory flowing by discounting select cars.

There has not been any across-the-board price cut since end of January. 

Without more drastic price cuts a significant part of the #RORO shipments could end up in end-of-quarter inventory.

Out of 86 M3 listed as "new" on the 🇨🇭 $TSLA site, 70 were manufactured in 2020. 

35 of them have been marked as "demonstration" or have a discount, even if no miles on them.

Discounts:

$TSLA 🇨🇭 is now advertising these discounts via email.

Last Q they would offer some free charging and low interest rate on leases.

Now the discount is explicit. The mentioned absolute amount of 3kCHF is about 7% of ASP! https://t.co/d9yMngeoDE

$TSLA 🇨🇭 has about 60 M3 manufactured in Q4 2020 that have not been sold. 

Discount for US-made is
🔹1% with < 50km on odometer.
🔹2-4% if > 50km on odometer

Discount for MIC is 12% (only 2 visible units left)

Inventory:

$TSLA 🇨🇭 has 12 M3 manufactured in Q3 2020 (US) that have not been sold. 

Discount is 
🔹4-7% with < 50km on odometer.
